questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the PostHog Agent SDK?
options: To provide a TypeScript SDK for building agents in PostHog's Array desktop app
To manage database connections for PostHog
To handle user authentication in PostHog
To process analytics data from PostHog

questions.question: What are the key features of the PostHog Agent SDK?
options: Tool calling, multi-step reasoning, and memory management
Real-time data streaming and analytics
User interface components and styling
API rate limiting and caching

questions.question: How is the Agent SDK configured?
options: Through environment variables and configuration objects
Through a web-based dashboard
Through command-line arguments only
Through hardcoded settings in the source code

questions.question: What permission system does the Agent SDK implement?
options: A tool-based permission system with read-only and modification tools
Role-based access control (RBAC)
Attribute-based access control (ABAC)
No permission system

questions.question: What is the scope of the canUseTool hook in the Agent SDK?
options: It applies only to the build phase and direct run calls, not to research and planning phases
It applies to all phases of agent execution
It applies only to the research phase
It is not used in the Agent SDK

answers.selectedOption: To provide a TypeScript SDK for building agents in PostHog's Array desktop app
Tool calling, multi-step reasoning, and memory management
Through environment variables and configuration objects
A tool-based permission system with read-only and modification tools
It applies only to the build phase and direct run calls, not to research and planning phases
